items.content_html:
Writing for Byline Times, Olly Haynes has revealed troubling content shared by Richmond Park candidate Michael Hearn.

The article reveals that Hearn previously faced calls to resign from the Conservative Party after sharing far-right material. In 2018, as reported by Evolve Politics, Hearn had listed Hajo Hermann as an â€˜inspirational personâ€™ on his Facebook account.

Hajo Hermann was a Nazi lawyer who went on to defend Holocaust deniers (including David Irving) and neo-Nazis in court late into his life.

Hearn is also reported to have shared content from neo-fascist group Generation Identity, and Britain First.

Calling for people to vote for Reform on Facebook recently, Hearn is reported to have written â€œas an Englishman we have seen our entire country changed without our consent without thought without consideration to our tribes within the kingdom our heritage and cultureâ€, and â€œrapists murderers terrorists and tomorrowâ€™s groomers of our children can just walk inâ€.

Hearn appears to have at least two Twitter/X identities (@StormHearn and @HearnStorm), both of which combine parts of his full name, and are linked by references to the East India Company logo, references to Stevenage, and being a paramedic. Both of these accounts have posted racist content. For example, in a reply to a post referring to London Mayor Sadiq Khan walking his dog, @HearnStorm posted

Has he strapped small explosive vests to them yet like his friends in Hamas do.

items.title: Edward Oakenfull claimed immigration linked to IQ decline
items.summary: The Derby Telegraph reports that Derbyshire Dales candidate Edward Oakenfull claimed the UKâ€™s IQ was being â€œdilutedâ€ and put in â€œsevere declineâ€ due to immigration.
items.content_html:
The Derby Telegraph reports that Derbyshire Dales candidate Edward Oakenfull claimed the UKâ€™s IQ was being â€œdilutedâ€ and put in â€œsevere declineâ€ due to immigration. The comments, which Oakenfull would later claim were taken out of context, were madeon Twitter/X in June 2023, after losing an election for a borough council seat in May:

The gene pool decline is another interesting area. By importing loads of sub Saharan Africans plus Muslims that inter breed the IQ is in severe decline.

Other comments include allegations that â€œnothing good will come out of importing yet more Muslimsâ€. He added, â€œYou think the pro Palestine/ Hamas marches over the past few weeks are disturbing, you ainâ€™t seen nothing yet!â€

Oakenfull also said in November: â€œThere are loads of different minority groups within the police, Black Police Officers Association, Muslim, even Turkish, what the hell happened to the police? They succumbed to woke and are now just not fit for purpose.â€ In December he said: â€œThe newly appointed Chair of the BBC is a Muslim, another reason to cancel the license (sic) as you just know more woke drivel will be churned out!â€

Approached for comment, Oakenfull said:

With regards to the comments made by myself on twitter, the majority are taken out of context for example the comments regarding importing sub Saharan Africans and diluting the gene pool, this was part of a conversation regarding a book called the Bell Curve which relates to IQ levels in different countries around the world. I was discussing the content of the book.

With regards to the tweet about our police force. I welcome diversity within the police force but I donâ€™t agree with all the groups within the police force. It should be one police force not segregating different races within it. And in my opinion the police have become too soft and there is more emphasis on hate crime rather than real crime.

With regards to my tweet made on 10/11/23. Migration is off the scale and some Muslims who come to this country do not wish to integrate and we are seeing evidence of this with Sectarian Politics. With regards to my tweet made on 13/12/23. If the newly appointed Chair of the BBC is the best person for the job then brilliant.

However, we are increasingly seeing a tick box culture within our society of promoting minorities into roles rather than the best person for the job. With regards to my tweet made on 10/2/24. Large scale immigration has resulted in community tensions and lack of integration and an increase in anti semitism.

Source:

  • Reform candidateâ€™s resurfaced tweet says â€˜UKâ€™s IQ is being dilutedâ€™

items.content_html:
The Times reports that Grant StClair-Armstrong has stepped down as Reform candidate for North West Essex.

In comments unearthed from a 2010 blog, StClair-Armstrong encouraged voters to vote for the British National Party. He wrote â€œI could weep now, every time I pick up a British newspaper and read the latest about the state of the UK. No doubt, Enoch Powell would be doing the same if he was alive. My solution â€¦ vote BNP!â€

The comments were found on an archived version of the website, which has since been changed.

When approached by The Times about the comments, StClair-Armstrong said: â€œI donâ€™t have this stuff on my website any more. â€¦ I removed all that stuff and made the website respectable. â€¦ I cleaned up my act a long long time ago. Iâ€™m sure if you look around youâ€™ll find some really nice posts, how I feel about animals, animal welfare, how I feel about the planet. Itâ€™s not all bad.â€

Regarding the Enoch Powel and BNP comments, he said â€œIâ€™ve got no excuses for that. I think theyâ€™re a disgusting party. I donâ€™t like the English Defence League. I donâ€™t like them.â€ He added that he saw no alternative but to stand down as a Reform candidate.

Gribbin also wrote that women were the â€œsponging genderâ€ and should be â€œdeprived of health careâ€.

Just to cap things off, Gribbin also said Winston Churchill was â€œabysmalâ€ and praised Russian President Vladimir Putin.

The Reform Partyâ€™s initial response to criticisms of the remarks was to defend them, including telling the Jewish Chronicle, â€œWeâ€™re not going to sack him, heâ€™s done nothing wrong.â€

After initially declining to comment, Gribbin did later apologise:

I apologise for these old comments and withdraw them unreservedly and the upset that they have caused.â€

Commenting on his candidateâ€™s remarks, Nigel Farage claimed vetting issues caused by the unexpected election timing.
